Heating & Air Conditioning Repair from Sears Home ServicesAt Sears Home Services, our certified HVAC technicians specialize in comprehensive heating & air conditioning repair for every major brand and system type. Whether your furnace won’t start or your central AC isn’t cooling properly, we’re here to help with fast, reliable service.

Central Air Conditioning Repair
When your air conditioner isn’t keeping up, our team delivers expert air conditioning repair services to restore comfort quickly. We diagnose issues, replace faulty parts, and provide professional maintenance to extend the life of your system.
Our air conditioning repair services include:

Accurate diagnosis of cooling issues such as leaks, poor airflow, or strange noises
Replacement of key components like compressors, thermostats, and capacitors
Regular HVAC maintenance for peak efficiency
Complete central air conditioning installation and system upgrades


Furnace Repair
If your heating system fails, Sears Home Services offers expert heating repair for all major furnace brands, including Kenmore, Trane, Lennox, Goodman, Carrier, and Coleman. Our goal is to restore reliable heat to your home as quickly as possible.
Common furnace repairs include:

Thermostat issues: We’ll diagnose and replace faulty thermostats that prevent proper temperature control.
Furnace not turning on: Our technicians troubleshoot control boards, switches, and electrical connections to restore operation.
Burner or ignition failures: If your furnace clicks but won’t ignite, we’ll fix or replace ignition components.
Breaker tripping: Electrical malfunctions can cause safety hazards — let our experts identify and repair the cause.


Heat Pump Repair & Maintenance
For year-round comfort, Sears Home Services provides dependable heat pump repair and maintenance for ductless, mini-split, and hybrid systems. Our certified technicians deliver fast service and professional care.
Regular HVAC maintenance is essential for efficiency and longevity. Schedule annual inspections and coil cleanings with Sears to keep your heating and cooling system running at its best.


Why Choose Sears for Heating & Air Conditioning Repair?

Over 100 years of trusted home service experience
Certified HVAC technicians with local expertise
Transparent pricing and flexible scheduling options
Use of genuine manufacturer parts for reliable repairs
Certified installers for full system replacements when needed


Schedule Your Heating & Air Conditioning Repair Today
When your HVAC system isn’t performing as it should, turn to Sears Home Services for expert heating & air conditioning repair. We offer same-day and next-day appointments for your convenience.
Sears is your trusted partner for professional HVAC service — from accurate diagnostics and quality repairs to preventive maintenance that keeps your home comfortable year-round.
Choose Sears Home Services for dependable, efficient, and professional heating & air conditioning repair you can trust.

Frequently Asked Questions About Heating & Air Conditioning RepairWhat types of heating & air conditioning systems does Sears Home Services repair and maintain?Sears Home Services provides expert heating & air conditioning repair and maintenance for all major HVAC systems. We service central air conditioning units, ductless mini-split heat pumps, boilers, and furnaces from top brands.
No matter what type of system you have, our certified HVAC technicians can diagnose issues, perform repairs, and maintain your unit for year-round comfort and efficiency.How quickly can I schedule a heating & air conditioning repair appointment with Sears Home Services?Sears Home Services offers same-day and next-day appointments for most heating & air conditioning repair services.
If your system isn’t heating or cooling properly, you can book service online or call us directly for fast, reliable assistance. Our local HVAC technicians are ready to restore comfort to your home quickly and efficiently — minimizing downtime and inconvenience.Why is regular heating & air conditioning maintenance important?Routine maintenance is essential to the performance and longevity of your HVAC system.
Sears Home Services recommends scheduling heating & air conditioning maintenance twice a year — once before the heating season and again before cooling season.
Regular tune-ups help:

Improve energy efficiency and lower utility bills
Extend the lifespan of your heating and cooling equipment
Prevent unexpected breakdowns and costly repairs
Maintain consistent comfort and air quality throughout your home

With preventive service from Sears, your system will run more efficiently and reliably all year long.What makes Sears Home Services the best choice for heating & air conditioning repair?Sears Home Services stands out as a trusted leader in heating & air conditioning repair because of our long-standing reputation for reliability and expertise.
Our advantages include:

Certified HVAC technicians experienced with all major brands
Same-day and next-day service available in many areas
Upfront, written estimates before work begins
Genuine manufacturer parts for long-lasting repairs
Satisfaction guaranteed on all HVAC repair and maintenance services

Whether you need emergency heating repair, air conditioning maintenance, or a full system replacement, Sears Home Services delivers dependable, professional results you can trust.

full_content.content:
Why is regular heating & air conditioning maintenance important?Routine maintenance is essential to the performance and longevity of your HVAC system.
Sears Home Services recommends scheduling heating & air conditioning maintenance twice a year — once before the heating season and again before cooling season.
Regular tune-ups help:

Improve energy efficiency and lower utility bills
Extend the lifespan of your heating and cooling equipment
Prevent unexpected breakdowns and costly repairs
Maintain consistent comfort and air quality throughout your home

With preventive service from Sears, your system will run more efficiently and reliably all year long.

Glossary TermsWhat is a 608 Certification?The 608 Certification, mandated by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA), is required for HVAC technicians to legally handle refrigerants. It ensures technicians understand refrigerant types, environmental impact, and proper handling techniques.What is a Compressor?A compressor is a mechanical device that increases the pressure of a gas by reducing its volume, essential in various systems including refrigerators, air conditioners, and HVAC units for cooling and refrigeration processes.What is a Condenser?A condenser is a component of HVAC and refrigeration systems, responsible for releasing absorbed heat from the refrigerant into the outside air or a water line, thus facilitating the cooling process.What is a Capacitor in an AC Unit?A capacitor in an AC unit is an electrical component that stores and releases electrical energy to help start the motor and stabilize the voltage during operation.
